attributes.action: Place on hold the new legislation under the Roads (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act
attributes.additional_details: The local Christmas Lights festival and many other local events run by community's, now requires to apply for a licence to run events at a cost of £269. 00 each, plus employ and finance a Road traffic Management firm  to set out a road traffic plan. The average overall total cost would be in the region £1000.00 per event.  The  task was normally done by a joint PSNI and community group at no cost other than the hire of raod traffic signs.
attributes.background: The act did not receive  public consolation on the affect it would have on community's, resulting in groups being placed at major financial disadvantage than the larger commercial events,  the most disadvantaged being the small poorly funded local  community groups.

rejection.details: Your petition is about something that the Northern Ireland Assembly is responsible for.
